page_content.section_name: APPENDIX 5 - Multi-Message Sign Inventory and Application Schedule

page_content.parent_section_name: APPENDIX 5 - Multi-Message Sign Inventory and Application Schedule
page_content.text:
1. Sign panels must only be located in the frame location as shown.
2. Left side multi-message sign shown only.
3. Multi-message signs located on both sides of the roadway must form a mirrored image of the signs being displayed.
4. For sign specification go to www.mainroads.wa.gov.au > Technical & Commercial > Technical Library > Signs Index > Multi Message Signs Standards
5. For multi-message signs frame refer to Main Roads standard drawing 201031-0155.

page_content.parent_section_name: APPENDIX 5 - Multi-Message Sign Inventory and Application Schedule
page_content.text:
SignMain Roads Sign NumberPanel Size (mm)Sign Application and Description
MMS-ADV-11200 x 300'X' km AHEAD
• Must not be used in conjunction with a regulatory speed sign.
MMS-ADV-2600 x 600'X' km AHEAD
• Must not be used in conjunction with a regulatory speed sign.
• Sign may be classified as symbolic.
MMS-ADV-3600 x 60040 km/h AHEAD SYMBOLIC
MMS-ADV-3600 x 60060 km/h AHEAD SYMBOLIC
MMS-ADV-3600 x 60080 km/h AHEAD SYMBOLIC
MMS-ADV-41200 x 300AT INTERSECTION
• Must not be used in conjunction with a regulatory sign.
MMS-ADV-51200 x 300AT SIGNALS
• Must not be used in conjunction with a regulatory sign.
MMS-ADV-61200 x 600BLASTING AREA SWITCH OFF RADIO TRANSMISSION
• Only to be used where the posted speed is less than or equal to 80km/h.

page_footer: Multi-Message Sign Inventory and Application Schedule
document_title: Traffic Management for Works on Roads - Code of Practice
document_summary: The 'Traffic Management for Works on Roads: Code of Practice' by Main Roads Western Australia provides comprehensive guidelines for managing traffic during road works. It emphasizes the importance of safety for both road users and workers, detailing the responsibilities of various authorities and the necessary procedures for implementing Traffic Management Plans (TMPs). The document includes specific requirements for temporary signage, traffic control devices, and risk management, as well as the use of Truck Mounted Attenuators (TMAs) and other safety measures. It also outlines accreditation requirements for traffic management personnel and provides detailed inventories and application schedules for various road signs.
